segments.text: I see the woman so focused on her dish, almost in a trance, her mind elsewhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water cascades over the sink, making a small waterfall that she doesn’t notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s bizarre to think she’s oblivious to the chaos behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is teetering on that stool, and part of me wants to scream at him to get down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how reckless this is, not just for him but for everyone in here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so innocent, hand outstretched toward the jar, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t understand how the woman can be so absorbed when there’s obvious trouble brewing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That cookie jar, so tantalizingly close to the children, feels like an invitation to disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s frustrating to watch this unfold, knowing the potential for chaos is so high.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me wonder if adults sometimes get too lost in their own worlds to see the threats in front of them.
segments.speaker: PAR
